intro: Daviesia crenulata, commonly known as the rough Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and serrated leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to red flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Daviesia crenulata is often used in native landscaping due to its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
